i was there yesterday with my kids. it's a bit crowded on the viewing deck, but i enjoyed the ornamental plant stalls where you can buy different succulents at reasonable prices. and their owners/sellers are so friendly (the women sellers are all beautiful! :-)). we also loved the snacks especially the grilled dried squids that are sold on the stands. i'd love to come back there when it's no longer so crowded to buy more succulents and also to enjoy the view once again.
Its a bit hard to take photo perfect selfies cause the place is overcrowded.
Great place to unwind and the view is great
Nice place to see some mountain scenery
Nice view and ggood people :)
If you're looking for a location with an overview of Baguio, souvenir shops, and food trippings. This is one of the best spots for you. :)

The view: breathtaking as usual. Although if visiting during peak season, place can get really crowded and can make it hard for people to get onto the viewing area. Still worth visiting whenever you find yourselves going north.
So tight. So many tourist. Cannot take nice pictures. So smelly also.

This is a really beautiful place. It is nice on the peak of the mountain. You have a complete view of the area. It is stunning to see the clouds touching the mountains and view the entire place. Highly recommended. Make sure you bring your warm clothes since it is cold here.
What a cool place.
Nice place to relax and great place to enjoy the view
Breathtaking places where we shouldn't miss is the Philippines.
It's crowded. It does not show the view of the mines. It is more of a park now.
allowed too many people into the observation deck, not following minimum health protocol

This place is crowded compared to the first time I came here. The temperature has dramatically increased and the view that I enjoyed before is no longer the same. Prices had gone up including the 'pasalubong'. Parking spaces are not enough especially when buses are on the road. Never bring your car during lunch or later.

Traffic going up Mines View.Lots of potted plants for sale as you go to the view deck. The area is near the market for souvenirs and nick knacks and restaurants around the area.The view deck not very big but is packed with a lot of visitors.As always , the view is breathtaking.Pack a lot of patience if you plan on visiting the place.
Good tourist spot in a lovely city. Plenty of shops here and good views
I LOVE IT!

One of the popular spot in Baguio. Good for family visit. It‚Äôs a bit crowded on the deck especially during peak season. But the view is breathtaking. A bit disappointed that you have to pay for using the toilets even though they already asked for an entrance fee.
Beautiful place..üòç
Too crowded. The view could be seen elsewhere in Baguio. You can actually skip this, unless it's the souvenirs outside that you're after

The view is really amazing. However, the city could have done better to organize the flow of the people. If only there's a crew who can direct the people where to enter and exit, the experience will be more pleasant for the visitors.
Waste of time, vendors offer the same products. Plus the tourists throw their garbage anywhere. No disciplinary staff onsite.
It has a nice view of the mountains! They sell souvenirs and plants/flowers
Too much crowded for the business and stores inside the park..
Nice view. It's just too crowded
Nice view but a little bit crowded especially during weekends.
Great view! Great place to buy inexpensive souvenir items

This place gives you a breathtaking view. I suggest you rent a binocular (20pesos per 5min.) for a better viewing experience. To fully enjoy your few minutes of stay, there's a booth where you can rent a traditional costume, which you can wear for your whole stay at the deck.

Great view of the mountainous area and the sprawling houses alongside the road. Good possibility to buy spice plant and some ornamental flowers. Very touristic location which draws a big crowd. If you like to enjoy a serene view - you might as well forget it! Plenty of souvenir shops instead.Beware of the cooked corn cobs. Look better than they taste. Too old and probably better suited for cows.Other than that certainly a place to stop after you fought your way through the traffic.

Extremely crowded at all times, plagued with shops all over, view deck is nice but don‚Äôt expect anything impressive. They have added an entrance fee recently. Not sure how the place is going to be post-pandemic.

Heavy vehicle and foot traffic in going to the park and inside the area (esp in the observation deck). Nice view but was not able to really enjoy because the place was so crowded when we visited. Also, vendors are everywhere (selling plants, snacks, Baguio goodies, etc.). Place needs improvement though.

Stunning views of the mountains!But overly crowded during holidays and weekends. If you want to enjoy it better, go early morning!The places to eat nearby are quite expensive and unclean. So I suggest to eat elsewhere or in fast food.
Thought it was a big place to walk around but it was just a small place and crowded.
Best time to visit this place would be early morning. Catch the sun rise.
The view was great and it adds a little mystery when fog sets in.

What a view!  It's a really cool, natural rock platform, observation area, at the top of the mountain with a breathtaking view!  There are also lots of vendors selling souvenirs/pasalubong such as t-shirts.  In addition,  there are many food vendors and we ate some freshly picked corn on the cob on a stick with melted butter and salt, which was scrumptious!
Beautiful view from a cliff. It's good for photography. It's a nature observation deck.
The view is quite good but the place is over crowded with tourist.
Plenty of pasalubong places. Good place to get a good view of baguio. Parking can be hard on holidays and weekends.
the spot is usually crowded so i normally go here during early morning hours before sunrise.
the view was nice. they have plants for sale and foid can be brought inside. i don't like how they treat the horses

One of the most popular places in Baguio, but will not recommend during holidays as you will be stuck in traffic on your way there if you have a car. This place is packed with peopke during peak season. It is better to park somewhere not near the entrance where you can leave right away. Otherwise, it will take too much time. I just recommend this during off peak so you can appreciate the view more.
Rainy #paeng2022

Not the way it used to be where you got a wonderful view. Now the view is peppered with a lot of houses which is painful to see. The walkway to the view deck is full of small stands selling their ware. There's a section where you can rent the mountain province costumes and take unlimited selfies/pictures for 20 pesos per person. Fantastic to see people taking pictures in costumes as it's very colorful! Wonderful smiles all around!

Maybe i just got too old but going here now was less exciting than when i went as a kid. But i was very excited for the kids being their first time, seeing their astonished faces, am glad we went, also for the wife, its her first time too. Its was not as cold or crowded as I remembered but still, it became one of my unforgettable memories and hopefully for them it was the same experience.

They have developed it really well for tourists. The actual view deck is not accessible to wheelchairs or persons with disabilities but the other areas are. The view deck itself still offers a great view of the mountains though you need to be careful.

Mines View Observation Deck is quite nice. I wouldnt say its anything special, you can find similar views elsewhere just along the road or at different spots but it is a good view, so if you wish to go then its a nice viewpoint for sure. The problem is it can be very crowded and the traffic can be bad during peak hours.3 stars
Lots of plants for sale and photo opportunities in the area. You would need an hour to go around the area and take a look at the souviner shops.
Many people, still the same as prepandemic. Nice view.
View is nice though the place needs to catch up with cleanliness
just as the old times the sunrise is breathtaking and it is good to be out in the morning.

A very good place to relax with family and friends. So many souvenir shops and food places that will make your head ache from choosing. It has a great view and clean comfort room. Beware when it's rainy and always bring your umbrellas since the weather there is unpredictable. A recommended place if you enjoy the scenery of nature.
Cool place to enjoy the weekend. But a bit crowded.
If you are going to visit this place, dont forget to try their Ube and Strawberry taho.
One of Baguio's most known and scenic landmark. A must visit for tourist.

Though there was a little clearing, we were astonished by the view on where this attraction is located. It was so serene that the fog made us thought that at one moment in time we are close to heaven. There was also a lot of cheap souvenir shops around the attraction. Lived the place...
2nd time here. View is always nice
nice place to unwine and stress relief

The park is named Mines View since it overlooks the spectacular Baguio view of the Cordillera mountains and Benguet‚Äôs gold and copper mines. The park dates back to the American times, and it has stood the test of time. Mines View Park‚Äôs entrance fee is free for all visitors, but some activities inside like the Ifugao costume rental comes with a small fee. There are food concessionaires and souvenir stores inside. The Baguio view is breathtaking, so a camera is a must. The park is usually crowded on weekends, so make sure to come early, or just do your best to capture a good photo.
Popular place to go to when in Baguio so expect a huge amount of tourist.
Awesome view especially at sunrise. Best time to take a pic at sunset. Tourist place, gets very crowded. Walking distance to Good Shepherd Jam  Factory

At the time we visited, the place was too crouded but overall, it was a nice experience. I got to ride a horse and have a picture taken at P50/3 shots. Bought knitted clothes at a very affordable price.
Beautiful view of Baguio from here. Cheap Jeepneys available to and from the Jeepney station in town.
Breathtaking and you cana lso buy pasalubong here. Good shepherd is just beside the deck's parking lot so just in case you are looking for some ube jam

Place is well kept and it's no longer crowded by vendors. All the vendors there selling goodies usually just buys them at the Good Sheppard and marks them up 10-50 pesos each. You will thank me for this review. BUY them at the actual store which is just around the corner. Save $$$ and the expiry of the goods are better!
It seems a visit to Baguio is not complete if you don't go to Mines View Park and so we went. It's just one of those must see places in Baguio.

This place is breathtaking. I'm rather shocked to learn that admission is free (though the toilets are 5 pesos per use). There are numerous restaurants, stalls, gift and souvenir shops all around (a lot of stuff here is priced 3 for 100 pesos). You have to carefully time your shots and wait for the perfect moment to take pictures, because the fog keeps changing directions.
I view it for the 3rd time, and its still beautiful.
Cool place but it gets crowded as the day progresses.
After mines view...Just visit thai restaurant and experience the delicious foods.. üòò
Love the sunrise! I went there around 5:40 am and the warmth and the early morning chill that lingered were perfect combination. The plants for sale were another treat to the eyes.

Ive been to this place so many times but it never gets boring. The view is really amazing. If you want to appreciate the view try to be here early in the morning to beat the group of tourists coming up to this place. Relax and try their strawberry and ube taho(Soy pudding)
An early morning visit should be done in order to avoid the crowd.
Great view of the mountains of Baguio City, Philippines
It always happy to see the view in mines view. Its always crowded when peak season.
Very exciting place, awesome
I was fun and very relaxing! The view is great!

I must say that this place should be visited by everyone who wants to go to Baguio City. However, I would like to comment on how crowded the place is that it will make you feel uncomfortable staying there. Instead of enjoying the view, you will just feel uneasy and awkward because of the crowd. Moreover, I observed that there are people there who allow the tourists to ride on the horses that they take care of for a price. I saw how these horses suffered from this unbearable situation, but they are forced to stand there and act like they want to stay. I am sad for them, really. üôÅ

It‚Äôs too commercialized. Horses are all abused, like putting different accessories on their faces and changing the colors or their hairs. I really don‚Äôt like the way it is right now. Been there 25 yrs ago and it was really a pleasant place to visit.
One of my favorite tourist spots in Baguio..Breathtaking ang overlooking!!!
It‚Äôs a good place to take a picture and buy some cacti and succulents.

gets kinda crowded since it's a tourist spot, you can get a great selfie with the cordillera mountain range as your background; parking can be an extreme challenge though, specially during summer and Christmas holidays; good thing the good shepherd convent is just a few minutes walk away.
Beware of tourist traps. 50php per 3 photos when you ride the horses
Beautiful place,must visit for the awesome view of old mining town.
Its my first time in Bagiuo City,and we all enjoyed it...

Place is very crowded, you will have a hard time finding parking, better to use public transportation going here.A lot of pick pocket here be sure to be alert and vigilant.Some good restaurants are near here have some extra cash in case.The view is not as good as it was, the mines where not preserve.
So beautiful i really love to comeback here
A little crowded especially on weekends.

At peak hours/season, the place gets crowded. If you want to enjoy sight seeing in peace, then you'd be disappointed. Also, touriats there do not have any discipline. There are random plastic wrappers and bottles strewn about the area

I didn't actually went to the Mines View Observatory itself, my family members went there, though. I simply enjoyed looking at the plants that were being sold at the entrance bcz some of these are rare...i had no enough cash with me and so i lost the opportunity to acquire anything...

Some random dude was being a jerk on the horses but it had really good views. This is a must see destinations if you go to Baguio. Taxi ride cost exactly 160, and it was very easy to find a cheap going back to the city for a 10 pesos only. The views are great, and there‚Äôs lots of snacks and souvenir shops.

Very nice place and very good views. Be careful with the guy with a St. Bernard dog. He is a ripper. Also don't buy souvenirs here, it's way too expensive. If you want Baguio shirts for your photo shoot in Mines View, better stop at the shops in Botanical Gardens before heading up to Mines View, they are way cheaper, souvenirs are cheaper here too.
Definitely  go to place when you visit Baguio.
Good improvements on the rails and guide handles,,
A very excellent view that can take your breath away. Only if the other tourists would focus more on enjoying the scene instead of taking a lot of pictures.

great view, good people and definite must when in Baguio. Stop and check out the vendors so many lovely souvenirs to be bought. That view!!! Is spectacular. Baguio is a truly unique city in the mountains a real world treasure. I see why filipino flock here.
Mines view over view is a little bit dirty. Plastics are a plenty
Nice to visit early in the morning
As usual,beautiful views

Mines View Park¬†is an¬†overlook¬†park on the northeastern¬†outskirts¬†of¬†Baguio¬†in the¬†Philippines. It is five kilometers away from the Heart of Baguio, passing through the Botanical Garden, the Mansion House, Wright Park, and the Pacdal Circle.

Still has a great view.. but would want to bring back the old look of the park itself and take out the retail stores beside the park and inside the park.The gate is too colorful similar with the lions head.

The view is still breathtaking, but would be best if you visit it on a weekday so that there are fewer people.Also, I like the old Mines View Park entrance better and when there are no stores beside and inside the park.
Cool place in Baguio...love the view.
Very nice tourists spot

This place is already crowded. Sadly it is alot more beautiful back then when i last visited this,like about 8 years. Be aware of your valuables it might get lost because of the crowd. Taking pictures with the native (Igorot) , st. Bernard dogs and horses will cost you money, so just don't be surprised.

Great view! Affordable plants (money maker, bonsai, cactus, etc.), pasalubong (foods, shirts, etc.). We bought some plants, we have to secure a plant permit before we could transport it by plane and ship. Tried dressing up costume for Php 25, unlimited shots and no time limit. The only downside is that there were a lot of people in the deck. It can be somewhat uncomfortable. So we only stayed and took photos there for a few minutes.

Therw are ways to observe the view from the deck, but what I don't get is how people walk down the little aisle just to capture some photo. That may endanger their life when they recklessly do it. It would be nice if there are people who will do an outlook anytime there are aliens around.

I'm not quite sure what's so attractive about this place. But there seems to be a lot of people who come in droves here.We just happened to stay in one of the hotels nearby - just a minute walk from the gate of this place - and we checked this place out, seeing so many people going here despite the drizzling and cold weather.It's very crowded in here, at least on weekends and holidays; lots vendors - street food, potted plants, native/souvenir stuff and many others.There's no entrance fee, the place is open to the public. The view is supposed to be really nice from here, but that is not my impression. The views along the roads in the Mountain Province or even just on the way to La Trinidad/Baguio from La Union.

Hi. Have been here on holiday from UK. Baguio is a very interesting place to visit. Recommend you to visit. Hotel in the area are reasonable price. Lots to see. Very nice Army training camp to visit with own meusem.

Amazing view. Went there on a Monday morning that's why there's only few people were there and we got a chance to have this picture taken. Never go there if there are a lot of people because you won't enjoy the place. We never tried the photo-ops with the big dog and the photo-ops while wearing an Igurot costume since for us, it's nonsense.
It's too crowded but the view is great.
Sadly, Mines View is teeming with insurmountable businesses including use of poor horses
The place is crowded with people but the souvenirs are very cheap!

This place is filled with animals having sex with each other. I watched a couple of horses have sex. There were several other horses surrounding them and cheering them on. And they have a nice gift shop also. If you like to watch animals bang each other, this is the place for you!

To appreciate more what Baguio City has to offer, you should not miss the Mines View Park where you can rent a native costume, take picture with a St. Bernard doggie, ride a colorful dressed-horse and buy souvenirs for your friends and loved-ones.You can also see the mountainous city of Baguio in here. üòç
Great views and friendly staff. Extensive tourist kind of shopping. I bought a purple chili plant. Decent places to eat and chain restaurants nearby. Even horseback riding not far away.
Three stars,the cliff and the horses i expected too much.
A lot of food, souvenir and strawberry

Minesview has great sights but is incredibly overcrowded and underwhelming by itself. It has nice and cheap shops around it, eateries and even souvenir places, but the observation deck itself always has people in it - making it a literally tourist trap.I suggest going on a clear weekday with no holiday to avoid the rush of excursionists.Some of the ways to enjoy the place is to wear traditional Igorot clothes, get photos from the albino horses and look for some mountain plants.A little bit underwhelming.
Nice places you can go anywhere what you want

To be fair, we were there just before Christmas and it's a busy tourist time, but to be honest the view wasn't worth the fight for taxis, the push and shove of the hundreds of people. It was impossible to take a nice clear photo because there were just too many people.

As a local, Ive seen better view. Its just a place of business. A good place to buy souvenirs for fair price, you might need to ask prices from different stores to get the most of your money. A good place to take pictures if youre into horses that have hair dyes, some say its animal abuse but its for you to judge. There are better places for horse back rides and taking pictures. You can take pictures with the famous minesview St Bernards, (there are three of them probably more and they take shifts by the way). Really not a recommended place to go on a weekend or a holiday. The traffic going might not be worth it. One thing unique about the place is the grilled dry squid dipped in vinegar, its the only place in baguio where its sold (as far as I know).

I think they should improve the place it's more like a market than seeing a view I appreciate the 1st time i went there without the markets no restaurant around so that u can really see the beauty of the place just green trees and fresh air now u can smell the smoke squid their preparing and markets arround the place.
Nice place. Not much to do. With lots of plants to choose from and take home. Also, the museum of the crafts of the indigenous people is something. It makes me appreciate my culture more.
Great view..... Nice place to see with your family during vacation.  There are also many souvenir shop to visit.  And don't forget to visit Good Shepherd,  and buy some different jams....

Mostly a shopping destination..although the prices here are steeper compared to other souvenir stores within baguio.Yes you can see a mountain view at the viewing deck but you will literally have to fight for a space to take a pic otherwise you will end up in some else's frame. üòÇ or just wait for the crowd to thin out a bit before you could have a few seconds to snap.a.photo with the mountains as back drop.
Very nice view but probably more beautiful on a bright, sunny day. We went there and the weather wasn't that cooperative but we still enjoyed the place and the view of course. Going back for sure.

Not really much to see and do here. Just a view of the mountains that you can take a picture of and that's about it. There are many souvenir shops and street food sold outside. Plus, its walking distance from The Good Shepherd where you can buy their famous Ube Jam~
Great views many souvenirs to buy. Local foods, clothes etc. A good first place to visit in baguio

This place is one of the most visited attraction in Baguio and there's no entrance fee, the place is good for taking photos and selfies cause the lighting is very nice, the view is nice and for sure people who like to have their selfies get that natural glow from the sun, you might want to go here, you can also rent the ethnic Igorot clothes from the locals there to take pictures. Transportation is easy cause you'll just need to ride a taxi and they'll take you there. Souvenir shops are also all over the place so you won't have to worry in buying some for your self, loved ones or friends.

The place is okay. I grew up in a very similar place so I couldn't tell what's special about it. There were lots of tourists when I got there.. Overview deck was pretty much crowded.. though you really get to see a bird's eye view of the valley & mountains that surround the fiew houses (or buildings)..There was also a park.. there was a horse, a real one, with pink hair for picture taking that cost around 100 philippine peso (soo expensive), and that Beethoven dog too. Lots of cactus & other souvenir items for sale. It was a crowded place. Maybe i would've appreciated it more if there were only few people..
You can see the wonders and beautiful creations of God, How amazing... The view of the houses located at the mountain. The cool weather, no need to use air-conditioned unit.

Mines view is part of the checklist that you shouldn't miss. Great views. Expect to see allot of people there. You can have a picture with the st. Bernard dog, horse, or try to wear the Igorot costume.

It's a refreshing experience! Nice to see the beauty of nature at its best. The good climate in Baguio is perfect not only for family get away with the hassle and bustle of work and city life back in Valenzuela.

if you go there at this time there is actually no mine to be seen anymore. The place has become a standard destination for tourists though, and stores and shops have opened around it. Still, its a must-see for first timers given its place in Baguio. Traffic is still horrendous over weekends and i would suggest to pack light and be prepared to walk 1-2kms so you wont waste time in trafficThe mines are now subdivisions.
Bring your friends!

Very crowded, especially on weekends. Be very cautious of pick pockets; otherwise will give you a nice view. Most prices of goods here are higher than the real retail price. I prefer to go to Good Shepherd or Public Baguio Market for better products.Activities:You can rent Igorot costumes for 25 pesos.Take pictures with a Saint Bernard.Ride colorful horses (stationary) for picture purposesBuy in TianggesBuy Succulents, flowers, fruit bearing plantsEnjoy street foods
Nature is Art - Love for the land and people ensures future generations to appreciate ‚úåüèæüíïüåèüíßüå±

Great place to bring your guests or family for a quick visit and replenishments / refreshments. Love the bulalo, corn and cheese and the barbequed dried squid. Reasonably priced too. If you are souvenir hunting for relatives or your kid's teachers, this is a good place to get souvenirs or delicacies just make sure you bring along your bargaining skills with you.
Can be hard to find parking. Big variety of souvenirs and plants to buy. Only one outlet that sells coffee grind and it's not always open. The view was cloudy and dark because of the monsoon rains.
Nice view and good location for clicking some pics.
still the best area for Baguio Sunrise :-) Note though that the place has an entrance fee now (PHP 10)
It's a very nice and cozy place to go!
Amazing and beautiful place to unwind and relax.
Nice view above the mountains in Baguio, free place to visit. You can almost touch the clouds. Surrounded by many stores for gifts, and souvenirs.Highly recommended.

Visiting this place is one of the highlights of my recent Baguio trip. The temperature of Baguio and its cozy surroundings when combined together creates a very relaxing vibe. Even though there were lots of other tourists when we got there, it is still worth it. The view is breath taking. I am definitely going back here. There were also activities to try in this part of Baguio such as trying out Igorot costumes for only 20 pesos, horseback riding (wherein you'll just take a picture with a horse) and many more. There were also lots of stalls and stores here that sell different products such as plants and souvenirs. :)

How could I not share my review about this tourist destination in Baguio? This is perhaps include in the top most visited place in the Philippines. Obviously, there's no more mining activities down there. But it is a manifestation how rich the place is in terms of natural resources. It is not only about tourism.
Make sure you come in early to get the right opportunity to take a photo! The place can be very crowded at peak times. Try to take a photo during golden/blue hour for that perfect snap.
You can still see some mountain slopes but not like before

The place is okay, the view is meh, but still good for pictures though. There are many little potted plants and bonzais here though. After visiting this place you can head over The Good Shepherd for the pasalubongs for the family.

As a local, I appreciate how much Igorot symbolism is showcased here. Good job to whomever is playing Igorot-themed music in some areas. The place is surprisingly clean despite the floods of tourists.The place is becoming smaller and smaller as more people come in, which is a good thing. But the surrounding vendors really ruin the experience especially that each booth serve the same thing, be it food or souvenirs. I wish Mines View choose to prioritize businesses that promote experience rather than just being lazy and display overdone souvenirs.

Go here eqrly in the morning like 7 AM and you have the whole place for yourself. It's peaceful, the fog is wonderful it's like you are really in the clouds. Perfect for meditation and just quiet time. You can also take advantage of the tourist services in Minesview with no queue.

The place has gotten so crowded, there's just so little room to actually enjoy the view. The market outside, is okay I guess, since it will offer you just as many , if not, more choices than those found at the Baguio Night Market.

This is one of the historical places of Baguio the Mines View Park. Aside from the busy kiosk, restaurant, market and for souvenirs. This is the complete place were you can see everything. You can have a picture taking from the colorful horse that they have. They also have Saint Bernard dog's they are really sweet and friendly. If you want to become an Igorot for a day you can dress like one. You like nature, orchids or plants they also have it in one place.

It is a great place with a great view. It is one of the must see places in Baguio. Aside from taking pictures with the view you can also take pictures while wearing a traditional costume from there with a affordable price. There are also souvenirs and different plants that you can buy.

The view itself is subpar but the experience along with it is fun. You can rent a clothes the resembles the lokal there or what they call a "bahag", take a picture while riding a horse and the best part in this place is the stores. There are so many souvenir shops in here with very affordable prices.
With a great view, souvenir items, and great shops -- this surely is a must place to visit. 5 stars! Definitely recommend.

Just visit when it sunny days for perfect view
people here are very courteous, the place also have access ramp for PWD's

Crowded as usual! But still a spot to visit!

A good place to view sunrise or sunset. They also offer pictures with a horse and 2 big dogs. A good place to buy bonsai, cactus, and some plants. The is a stall here where some Good Shepherd products were sold

Nice and enjoy our trips üòä.
This park without a doubt is always crowded but worth visiting ! A lot of snack, souvenir shop options, great photo shoot opportunities and most importantly has the best view of Baguio city!

Mines View Park contiues to be the best place to get your goodies and "pasalubong" if you're looking for the cheap deals.  However, there's waaaayyy too many people. So much so you can no longer appreciate the view that much. Still a good place to go to though...

Great view you can see the abandon mining area and the top view of baguio city. You can see here the st. Bernards dog, colorful horses, beautiful plants for sale, and you can dress like a locals.   And also good for the heart.
Again, memories of the old days of long ago and all i can think of is mi Querida Se√±orita.

Still good scenery people still love to go and take some selfies shot.  Traffic during peak season and during December lots of people goes in and out of mines view park. Horse back riding,  igorot inspired robes and some souvenirs. Still exciting place to go specially newbies
The place can be pretty crowded during the day.One of Baguio's best spots to watch the sunrise. Shops are closed, not a lot of people there and you'll enjoy the relative silence.

Go there early morning to get the best view of sunrise. We went there for a photoshoot. The crack of dawn makes dramatic separation of dark and light. The sunrise is magnificent.

The place is okay. One of the most visit worthy in baguio. Just make sure to go in there when its not foggy. The place has a lot to offer. Foods, photo ops with the big dogs, horseback riding, ornamental plants for sale and other souvenir items.

Went there as I was taking my Chinese clients to visit Baguio. Food was reasonably priced AND good! Just bad that the weather let us down as it started to pour. All in, they had a great time there.

I find it filty and not well maintain.  The site for horse picturial booth is too smelly. I love the view of the place it was cool and so many different flowers also. Place lots tourist visiting. You will also enjoy your photo taking session on this place because of the breathtaking view of the mountain.

Good place. Overlooking view.One of the tourists spot in Baguio.They stalls for souvenirs.They have horses for a picture taking.A wishing well.A small place but good enough.

If you intend to go here, i suggest going on a schoolday. Thats the best time to be able to appreciate the quiet beauty of baguio.
Very cool placeüëå

Almost impossible parking to get dressed up like an Igorot, sit on a pony, and take pictures.  You can eat the same foods, and get the same pasalubong and t-shirts in virtually any other tourist trap (and market) in Baguio.  Mine's View can be done once, then ü§∑

Mines View Observation Deck among other site activities is a venue especially for photographers who love landscape photography. The site is peaceful and quiet from 5 am-6 am when few tourists start to arrive. Enjoy the breathtaking landscape panorama of e.g., Benguet's Itogon views. The place offers one of the best sunrise landscape photography. There is no entrance free and the place is open until 8 p.m.

A popular location for tourist in Baguio to visit. There are a lot of people who goes to thisnplace especially in the afternoon. You can rent native costumes to have a picture as well as colored-hair horses.

In terms of Nature.. I can give it only 4 stars because there is so much rebuilding going on soon it will be called mines view city, and the 2 stars are for being over crowded.. be it inside or outside.. you can't enjoy the moment because of the uncontrolled crowd.I hope someone plan and do the proper thing before everything gets out of hand or it already has.

It is a nice place to shop for "Coming back from a trip Presents" or Pasalubong.  However the observation deck itself is not something that would be on top of my list to revisit.  This is because the deck area are hogged by tourists taking their photos like they are on a private photo shoot.It is just impractical to stand on those slippery boulders like begging for an accident just to have our own photos, because the paved deck is hogged.  Paying for little things including a picture with a St. Bernard dog is little crazy and becoming unappealing atmosphere to tourists to visit.  Yes it is helping local economy, but it is not nice to be taken advantaged on, just because.The park entrance is free, but it looks like a market scene than a place with peace and quiet as parks should be.   If you haven't been there it is fine to visit, but it is not a place I would recommend to revisit.

Mines View Park is 15 minutes away from town where formerly, you can view the Mines but now, you can just see houses and no Mines at all. Since it has been considered as a Land Mark of the City of Baguio, you can enjoy the fresh air while taking pictures at the view deck...
Gets crowded at times but still beautiful.
perfect to watch the sunrise here. because of the cold weather not many wake up early to catch the the sunrise. bring a cup/thumbler of coffee or hot choco.

Overrated and super crowded. To be fair, I came here during the peak season though. People just came up here to have their photos taken with the backdrop that was average at best. Too many people just fiddling with their phones posting their shots rather than enjoying nature itself.

In Bagio this one is the famous spot of scenic view of mountains and fogs. One can buy small artifacts, memoirs, handicrafts etc from a large number of shops available thereat. Various kinds of plants one can buy.

Minesview is never a-missed tourist stop over whenever we are in Baguio. Though most of the time we go there, traffic congestion is always the same issue. This hillview of Baguio is always packed with tourists and locals, though parking and passing through are always a challenge, we just cant seem to resist visiting this, as we crave for their local grilled foods, pasalubong sweets, novelty items, cheap potted plants, and the nostalgic feeling of the cold and breezy Baguio feels. Good thing the local government keeps improving this place, as they anticipate heavy flocks of tourists on holidays. We still keep going here to check what's new or any newly opened restaurants will tickle our taste buds :)
Lots of tourists all the time.  Getting a good pic is hard.  The view is beautiful but there still something to improve.

Igorot outfits for rent for pictorials within the park. Good place to buy pasalubong shirts, peanut brittle, strawberry jams and small plant variants.

I used to go here and still goes whenever I'm in Baguio.  The main observatory deck is full of trash due to lots of tourists. There's no trash bin near so people opted to throw trashes anywhere. I believe you can mandate a No Food policy inside the viewing deck, besides you're there to view Not to eat.2nd the mines view park signage on the left side is no photo worthy the background has a lot of different sari sari store signage and any advertising ad. This is the place where you can go back again and again...üå≤üíñ

Overlooking the former mines of Baguio. It's a great place to enjoy the mountain sceneries while enjoying shopping for your friends and family. Don't forget to drop by at Pantew restobar at Pinewood Place for a cup of brewed coffee. Then head to Goodshepherd convent for their famous ube jam and peanut brittles.

Mines View Park is an overlook park on the northeastern outskirts of Baguio in the Philippines, which is  5 kms  from city center, worth visiting for  awesome  views and  especially  watch  the  sunrise .I would  suggest to come  here  after  visting  Botanical Garden, the Mansion House, Wright Park, and the Pacdal Circle.Worth visiting when you are in Baguio.
Just feel the cool breeze, eat corn and grilled squid. You can purchase plants if you want, take a horse pic and buy souvenir.

Overly crowded - as in you get multiple strangers in your photos when you take them. The park itself is dirty and the view of the mountain ranges is not breath-taking anymore. Sad to see Mines View Park deteriorate like this.

Mines View is one of the most visited spot in Baguio City because of it's famous observation deck where all people take photos, horses, Ifugao costumes and St. Bernard dogs that you can take photos with, buy souvenirs all over the place, and overlooking restos where you can dine and see the beautiful mountains of Baguio.
The place, now, HAS 10 PESOS ENTRANCE plus the usual facemask, QTP, and vaccination card.
It's okay

Trying the native attires! Cool place!

If you're budget wise. You can get here for only 10pesos! One of Baguio's tourist destination.  Great  views and local shopping.  Be careful the area is quite steep. Take plenty of pictures.

The Best place for summer, it has so many souvenir and commodities in the are at low cost. thank you Baguio people for very accommodating environment  whenever we ask of direction they politely tell you of honest and exact direction.

This place is too crowded. Going here means you have to endure traffic. You just have to see this place ONCE because there's nothing else to see here. Other than that, you can buy succulents or other plants. Wear local costumes, have your photo taken. Have another photo with an overworked saint bernard and leave. After that you can get yourself an overpriced 'taho' (taho is much cheaper in metro manila). This place is a Baguio City landmark btw that's why people go here.
Nice view

Baguio in itself has turned until cestpool of traffic. Cars and people everywhere. That still didn't deter us from coming to this tourist hotspot. The walkway leading to the observation point is adorned with vendors selling plants. There is a stall that allows you to dress up like native igorots with cape, hats with the word BAGUIO over your forehead and a sun necklace although you're not allowed to bring the costumes down to the observation deck. I think we just paid 25 pesos. The lower part of the observation deck no longer has begging children that I used to remember back in the days that would brave the dangerous rocks below asking for coins. The view has somewhat been tarnished with homes in the distance and you can barely see the mines itself anymore.
It offers a great view for 10 pesos. crowded at all times. you can buy here some Baguio foods and plants.
here's to one of the most popular attractions when you go to Baguio. You can't possibly miss this one. The scenery and weather here is breathtaking.

Always a great place to visit. Although the last one was a bit disappointing because of bad weather but we still got to see the view.

Okay for first-time visitors.

Good and convenient because of the different stalls and souvenir items.It is advisable to visit during sunny or summer not on rainy season

This is one Baguio destination that you don't want to miss. Your Baguio tour is not complete without dropping by the Minesview Park and take a selfie at the view deck. This is also where you can buy your favorite souvenir and a few walk will bring you to the Good Shepherd to buy the best Ube (purple sweet potato) & Straberry jams. Parking in this area is really scarce.

the place is a good spot for an overlooking view of the city.

The view is breath taking...the climate also make you feel like that you are out of the country...the strawberry taho and ube taho is a must to try here...also you can buy souvenirs at low cost compare to other places in Baguio...The saint bernard dog also was so cute and a must to picture when you come here...also they have jeepneys that will drop you to other tourist spot near mines view park...

nice view

Such a breath taking view!!! Cool breeze

Philippine bazaar market at its best. I mean when you want a merchandise you have 50 little merchants who want your business. This place is old but its character is pleasing. Every ones very nice. Haggling is encouraged.

Place is clean and well-maintained.With good police visibility, which was good as you feel secured. Vendors are organized and helpful.This is place is nostalgic, nothing much had changed since I last went here years ago.
Always visit the market for vegetables and pasalubong shopping. Bring your own tote bag. Ask around for the best price, you will always find the lowest price towards the middle of the market.

Clean as ever... But you have to be wiser when buying... You have to canvas, haggle price and still check whatever you bought if it's complete, just that you don't have to go back there to pick up what's missing. üòÅüòÄ

Mahal na  ang presyo.  Look  at  different  sellers  because  the  difference  in price   go  up  to as much as 100 pesos.  Fruits and veggies  fairly priced. The   sweets and  pasalubongs really differ per stall.Best  buy  are the  yarns! Comes in all colors  and variants

I visited Baguio Market on weekdays so I am not really sure if its crowded every weekend. Their pasalubongs are all cheap in price. Sweets, walis tambo, tshirts, seafoods and etc. You may choose this place for pasabulongs and souvenir if you dont want to visit the good shepherd since its a bit pricey.
Nice market, very organize and clean esp. on the fruit seller area.
You should never miss the market when visiting Baguio City. Love the coffee, took me almost 1hr! Its clean. Follow the traffic signs, Loading/Unloading road side.
Lots of options to see and choose from. Great value for money. This is my favorite market in the country because it's so clean and orderly.

Go to Stall #13 for your walis tambo needs, and Stall #149 for your pasalubong needs. They can give you discounts!As for your Vigan longganisa fix, you can buy it from.manong who sells it at nearby stalls that sell handwoven pasalubongs and flowers.Great place to buy your pasalubongs: Vigan logganisa from Manong. His stall is beside a small flower shop in an alley near the stalls that sell handicrafts and blankets. Get your walis tambo that lasts for years at Stall #13, and your coffee beans from Garcia's.
A good place to purchase pasalubong or just simply buying food for your daily needs when staying in Baguio City. The price is very affordable specially the vegetables.

They say that public markets reflects the soul of every town or city and I seem to agree with it. Since my early childhood, I have been going around this place whether to buy fish and meat at the wet market and hire Marvel and DC comics at the souvenir section.The Baguio City market is not exactly the best place that one can go to buy things for the family. Its wet market section is really wet and never dry. Its vegetable section is no longer for veggies only. There is also a missing center park at the market where I used to shine shoes as a child but it is now occupied by stalls where mixed goods are sold. My government job at the Department of Trade and Industry requires me and my colleagues to check on their food items in conjunction with other agencies like the Department of Health and we do on-the-spot inspection.I rate this place 1 star only as it really needs sprucing up. Since the early 80s, the place was gutted with fire and I'm sharing my images here. I'm looking forward to the modernization of this public market.

A place to go if you intend to stay in Baguio for a week and save money on food and items.You will find most of what you expect on a Wet & Dry Marketplace. If you are not in the hurry best to check different stalls first for the best price on the same item. Be kind to the vendor it will make the price negotiation a lot smoother.If you are a tourist or foreigner best to hit this  place with a local friend to avoid being overpriced.Overall the Local Gov has done great in monitoring vendors who overprice and handle it. A must check place for souvenirs and treats.
Clean, accessible and cheap prices for veggies, fruits and pasalubong

Feel neutral about this place. The people are nice and friendly. There may be some chances though that they will add more price to what the product should cost. So I would recommend you to buy from stalls that have their price tags displayed. If you're one of those who are great at bargaining, do it but keep in mind that they are all working hard to make ends meet. üëå

As a home cook who pretends to chef, a fresh meats, fish and veg market spanning between three and four city blocks is a good way to lose an entire afternoon. As usual with a large open market, the best deals take time and searching.
Great to do the shopping..love the place

You'll buy a variety of needs and wants here from veggies to fruits to household items and even preloved clothes and many more! It's a bit cheaper compared to those being sold inside malls.However, don't expect this public market to have tiles and other luxury architecture as it is old and sometimes, when its rainy, you'll meet huge, furry rodents!
Here in Baguio Public Market you can buy product using gcash.
Where you can buy vegetables, coffee, and other goods at low prices

IMO Baguio wet and dry market could do with an upgrade. The vegetable section is very dark and flooring all over the market is dangerously uneven for more senior customers. Since it's always bumper to bumper traffic in downtown Baguio and parking is at a premium, the city could maybe also consider opening smaller fruit and vegetable open-air markets away from downtown?
The options of what you can buy are great. The vegetables are cheap, of course, it still depends on whether a storm damaged crops.  The only problem there is the parking.
Great market. If I lived in Baguio I would definitely shop there for meats, veggies and fruits. Also there's plenty of clothing and apparel options.

The market is pretty expansive and beautifully chaotic. The front will house the touristy pasalubong center where you can buy your Ube Jam, Peanut Brittle, Walis and things. At the back of that will be the general merchandise. Further in would be the wet and dry market. Be prepared and walk with comfy shoes, the entire market area would be similar in size with a small baranggay.
Local produce for your liking
Still the same Baguio City market that we used to love. If you are driving a car, parking might be a problem. To support the local community, take the public transport instead if you have the time.

This is the ultimate pasalubong center of baguio city. Fruits, sweets, delicacies, decors, food, coffee beans, brooms, handicrafts and so much more. Don't forget to visit when in Baguio. Still the same since the 90's!
If you plan to buy pasalubong. Go to the public market, you'll get most of them for a cheaper price. The vegetables are also fresher and cheaper here.
Cool and very nice to buy all pasalobong from there
what i love in this market is the wide selection of local goods and most of it is cheaper. will definitely going back to this place

This has to be on your bucket list if you visit Baguio. I have yet to see a market  like it. It sells everything you expect in a market. You have all the smells that you would expect.It has all the characters that you would expect,but it has somethings that you would never expect! The stall holders are so friendly and there a few surprises too,but I will keep  quite about that . Also if you are are into market places Baguio has a 9pm to 2am market for those of you wanting a late experience.  As I always say for a 5 star award you certainly will not be disappointed.
You can find fresh things here such as fruits and vegetables, seafoods, and meat. A good place to browse wares and such as well.
There's a lot of Pasalubong that you can get, there's food and memorabilia and etc. here. some of these pasalubong are handmade by the the people there.

As a Benguet local, I see lots of opportunities for improvement in the market but I could say that it has a lot more to offer than other public markets I have visited from north to south luzon, so far.
if you are to buy pasalubong, here is the place to be, the area is complete of all sorts of pasalubong, from baguio's famous walis, strawberry jam, ube jam, peanut brittle etc
Became big and wide also clean^^‚ô° Very good^^‚ô°
Friendly vendors. Many choices of fresh fruits vegetables and other native preserves of Benguet province.

The pictures below were taken in the pasalubong area, but the Public Market of Baguio is huuuge. It extends up to the upper part of the block, where you can see the Wagwagan, or the shops selling cheap second hand clothes and shoes. Great treasure trove for winter clothes for your travels. In the pasalubong (souvenir) area, you can find soooo many stores where you can buy the best Baguio goods to choose from, at the best prices. You can haggle and get the best offers especially if you‚Äôre buying bulk. Various items are sold -local delicacies, packed snacks, fruits, vegetables, coffee, and other locally sourced products in the province of Benguet. As in any other public markets, be sure to take care of your belongings and your children.
It's good for all the visitors,,all nice views are here like united Stone kingdom, strawberry farm,and others
Your P100.00  if spent wisely can buy you so much pasalubong at the Baguio City Public Market.
We went at the market on a Monday.  It was less crowded and was a lot easier to navigate  through the stores.

Strawberries, Lettuce and Broccoli together with the famouse peanut brittle and famous Jams everywhere. Price is now regulated as per the vendors for the snacks but the vegetables here are very cheap and fresh. Be sure to bring a bick sack for your veggie shopping üëå

Fresh and cheap vegetables and fruits. Vendors are polite and kind. There is a restroom inside as well as a police station. Also the place to buy pasalubongs, Benguet coffee, flowers and strawberries.
Night market every night from 9pm to 2am @ Harrison road,baguio city,benguet,Philippines. One of the tourist attraction in baguio city.
Sharing with you the best shop to buy pasalubong, Aling Judith offers the cheapest price but same quality and brand. Please see their stall # for reference.
Freshness is guaranteed. There's always a bargain here. A real one stop shop for your pasalubong and kitchen needs.

This place has so much items with affordable price... You can buy some souvenirs here such as Print Shirts and Keychains and also fruit wines..The veggies here are so fresh.. and the vendors are well mannered...
Fresh fruits and vegetables on sale. Very neat market with with accommodating tinderas. A must see in Baguio even if you are not buying anything. The way the sales are presented is an art itself.
Clean,  love seeing all the fresh vegetables,, meat and a line of souvenir shops that is all Baguio

Loved by most people coming from all over the Philippines, especially from MNL. Cheapest prices for fruits and vegetables which are available everyday and very very fresh! Lemons, strawberry, lettuce, br√≥coli are just a few of my favourite items ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

A lot of souvenir shops and fruit stand in the area. A touristy one i think. I love fruits so i was so happy I visited the are since they are selling a lot of variety of fruits. There were jams and other pasalubing too like ref magnet, tshirts, keychains and other stuffs.

What i like about this market is the fresh vegetables.  they are fresh and cheaper than the rest of the markets around. Strawberries are also cheap and so are the coffee beans and ground coffee some of which are flavored. Also available in this market are Mountain Maid products like Lengua de Gato and Ube Jam. and if your bags are full and heavy, there are "extrahands" who are very willing to carry them to where you are parked.
Hope the city government will fix the wet market section and inspect the sewers and elevate the stalls so it's not so dirty and stinky.

Fruit and vegetable market heaven.   Go to the inner stalls along narrow walkways to get lower prices, and avoid the main selling areas.  They also sell low land fruits and dried fish products and native rice cakes from pangasinan.  Check also the grains and beans sections.
If only ALL markets we're like this in the Philippines.

I visited Baguio Market in June 2022. There was rain in the place so it would be best to bring umbrella to help in shopping for our favorite coffee available in Umali and Garcia. Remember also buy balikutcha to add sweetness to the coffee.

Be careful of the loading and unloading areas to avoid traffic violations. Go to the middle part of the market to find the cheap but fresh vegetables (bagsakan). It's just past the Cuevas Bakery and along the stores that sells ground coffee (we bought from Garcia). Best to bring your own ecobags. There are market guys (kargador) who offer to carry your bags for a fee.
A lot of things to buy here but always wear your mask, bring alcohol and your most comfy shoes because you'll be needing it. One of the crowdiest place in Baguio because its a market!

A typical market set-up...but what's unique are the produce only indigenous to Baguio...from fresh strawberries üçìto the freshest vegetables such as lettuce and sayote tops...from purple yam to strawberry jams...there are also coffee vendors around...there are colorful walis Tambo to Bonnets and cardigans! Everything Baguio is here in this market! Enjoy shopping üíï
Great place to go for the variety of meat, fish and grocery at an affordable price. Can get busy at times but well worth going there despite that.
Looking where to buy a pasalubong here is the best place for cheap and affordable prices of all kinds. From vegetables,strawberries,sweets delicacies of Cordillera best.

I love it have everything you could need plus it's cheap .... There is masjed at shoes market thereŸÖŸÉÿßŸÜ ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ ŸÑŸÑÿ™ÿ≥ŸàŸÇ ÿÆÿßÿµŸá ÿßŸÑŸÅÿßŸÉŸáŸá ŸàÿßŸÑÿÆÿ∂ÿßÿ±  Ÿà ŸáŸÜÿßŸÉ ŸÖÿ≥ÿ¨ÿØ ÿπŸÜÿØ ÿ≥ŸàŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿßÿ≠ÿ∞ŸäŸá
A must go to if you are visiting Baguio to buy pasalubong, souvenirs, and fresh produce

Looking for fresh meat and vegetables? Nothing can be more fresher than the vegetables offered here. They have most of the vegetables available here, some are not even available in some markets in Manila. It's much cheaper to buy from the market and cook it yourself. They also have great selection of fruits and local products like "kakanin". With the longganisa vendors, look for those not in the front as those tend to be cheaper. Those in the picture are mostly for tourists. Avoid going here all "touristy" so you can haggle for the price or get better deals. If you're looking for liempo, they call it "ping ping" here. If you're hungry with all that shopping, they also have some food stalls here where you can buy meals or snacks. Look for those individual vendors on the side of the road to support them and avoid haggling for the price.
Fresh vegetables at very reasonable prices. There are also rows of local delicacies like strawberry and ube jams.

A place where you can find Baguio souvenirs in cheaper prices compared to other tourists spots, specially when you planned to buy a lot. You can find everything from wall decors, t-shirts, cordillera customs, keychains as well as fruits,vegetables etc.
Great place to haggle for a bargain especially for the pasalubong (food and mementos for take aways). Popular food items to buy are strawberry jam, ube jam, peanut brittle, spicy dilis, etc.
Where there are delicious fruit!!!Mango sells at 150 pesos a kilo..And a lot of people...!!!I recommend going on weekdays.
Store owners are very nice, probably the best place to buy "pasalubong" in Baguio City. It would be best if you go to the public market in the afternoon or after the morning rush.

Very organized and easy to get to. Plus it does not have the usual ‚Äúpalengke smell‚Äù that‚Äôs common in all Philippine public markets. Stalls are spaced out evenly so there is very little chance of it getting cramped in non peak hours (late morning onwards) and it‚Äôs also the place where you could get decent cheap coffee. There are 2 main coffee players - Umali and Garcia. I always go to Umali since they have what I like - Sagada Arabica medium roast plus it‚Äôs less packed than Garcia. A fun experience overall.

This is one of the very fortunate market in the Philippines which is naturally airconditioned. Hehehehehe.Every time I come to Baguio, I am looking for fresh mushrooms. Of course, Broccoli, Cauliflower, Sayote Tops, Baguio Cabbage, Lettuce and so many vegetables. The price here is cheap. Almost 30% less price than the markets in Manila.There are many souvenir shops too. I enjoy my market here. I hope you enjoy too!
The cleanest public market I've been! There were also Police Personnel rounding the area. They have cheaper veggie price compared to other market places. Kudos Baguio!
Fresh &  inexpensive farm produce & products! Definitely a must visit before heading back to Metro Manila.

When you get to Baguio, this is one of the places where you can get some of the freshest produce. They have vegetables, fruits, meat and anything you could ask for.With cheaper price.TIP:Wear boots if you visit the wet market.Wear comfortable clothes.

It's not my first time to go here but it's always a pleasant surprise. I tend to discover things that I must have overlooked in the past. This is a vast and sprawling complex of stores, shops and finds, diversity at its best. Fresh fruits and veggies can be found here. Souvenirs as well. The place to go to when buying your pasalubong.
The Baguio City Market is a place where every Baguio Guest must come to visit. Here, cheaper prices could be found from marine to meat and poultry products.
Baguio City Market is the Place where you buy everything around.Just asking Somebody where's the Place a things you wanna buy,the. They will show you.
Perfect place to buy pasalubong
Has most of what you need and is nice to walk around but predominately phone shops and shoes.
Parking is a problem. So ride a taxi. Prices of vegetables are the same as MM. But fresh. Fish variety is limited. Not too crowded. Maybe because I was there on a Friday.

A short visit to the Baguio City Public Market is a must in order to shop for fresh strawberries & Filipino delicacies. We shopped for things to take with us on our trip to Banaue. That we did once in our 3 nights stay in the City. It was an interesting walk we had around the dry goods area, flowers shops & fruit shops. Prices were reasonable.

Nice in the morning when it's not yet too crowded. A lot more organized now than how I remember it as a kid. Best to go early before around 6or7am so that it's not yet too crowded and there's still lots of parking. It's nice to stroll around and look for good finds and the best price.

‚Ä¶ pasalubong area still clean and organized. Did not have the time to check prices prior to going and later found out that veggies sold in this area are more expensive than those sold in the regular wet market area. The loading and unloading points are strictly enforced and it makes a lot of sense to regulate traffic in this busy area.
Affordable strawberries, P220/kilo. But you have to watch and be vigilant on the items that you are buying esp strawberries. Some ventors might switch your fresh bag to rotten straberries bag.
Its fine their is alot of people asking for money. The products are good

It is the best place to stop by before going back home! Our visit here is never complete without buying pasalubongs and vegetables here. It is true that pasalubongs are being sold everywhere in Baguio but I personally prefer buying in this market -- stocks are newer, more variety, and it is always fun to haggle for prices.
One of the cleanest and most organized public markets I have visited in my entire life. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Best rustic market place. No need to be replaced into a building to be like a mall. This should be preserved.
The market is clean. Lots of things to buy. Veggies are way cheaper than in Manila.... A must before going back to reality in Manila....

Baguio City Public Market strictly implements social distancing in this time of pandemic so when you check out your pasalubong and very affordable fruits and vegetables, please don't forget your face mask and face shield and observe social distancing.
Nice place to visit for your daily needs. Fresh fruits and veggies. Fish and meat. Even dry goods are available.

its normal,ive been there since  im a baby ..to kid ..to adult ..married and widowed ...the only difference was years .....

Nice and very helpful salesgirls whether you're purchasing from them or not.

the baguio city public markets is a cleaniest market ever a lots of fresh fruits and vegetables also the jams for pasalubong napakamura lang.

The fruits are so fresh!! Also the lettuce & broccoli are in a right price'. The local foods are so delicious.

one of the best public market i can recommend its clean organized good selections of merchandise from souvenirs to fresh vegs amd fruits price is moderate not so expensive its has clean public rest rooms safe not so crowded

Not just once but many times I visit thewet and dry market.... the "fishy" smell has been minimized.... My nose gets me irritated when I pass or buy fish and meat items here....

Best for pasalubongs and veggie cheap finds to bring home to metro. You get to visit one area with stalls offering variety of pasalubong and compare prices from one to another. Very nice clean and many good product to buy
This area is full of items that you need to buy for pasalubong or necessities that you need for everyday but unfortunately, parking is one hard to find.

Walked through the markets as a tourist. Many markets and products to see. I was not accustomed to so much crowding in small places. There are some American fast food restaurants. The food is good and reasonably priced but, everywhere was over-crowded. No seats.

We were ecstatic to finally explore the City Market. It was cleaner than expected, and the vegetables were so fresh and delicious! Prices were so much cheaper, though you really have to make the uphill trek to get to Hangar and Hilltop, which are cheaper than the market area at street level. But the quality and prices of the veggies are so worth the aching legs.
Got here via Grab. Some pasalubong delicacies are priced overcharged because they know we were tourists, we hope they provide fairer pricing for tourists, next time.
Always like the markets all over the world. Great people sharing their wares. Exceptional bargains and always fresh
When in Baguio.Locals are always helpful and trustworthy

Majority of the stalls are still using manual weighing scale to weigh their products. This type of scale is easily manipulated and buyers are usually cheated with the weight and price. The LGU should implement using digital weighing scales.

City of pines and used to be the honeymooners haven thats during the early 60's and 70's but until now our market hasnt been develop yet. Hoping so much the next administration will focus on this rehabilitation.
Be early in buying fruit and veggies here.
Where you can buy almost everything you want.

It is the cleanness market I have ever been as of now. The prices here are somehow cheap too. My favorite part of the market was the souvenir section where I bought my shirts and other delicacies. The comfort room here is also clean and well organised even though it is not that high class. Another one good thing about it was that I was not lost on my ways its is very accessible and easy to find.
